## ğŸ” Code Quality
- [ ] Code follows the teamâ€™s design patterns and architectural principles.
- [ ] Variable, method, and class names are clear, descriptive, and consistent.
- [ ] No dead code (unused or commented-out code)
- [ ] No duplicated logic unless justified.

## ğŸ“Œ Functionality
- [ ] Changes directly address the related issue or task.
- [ ] Existing functionality remains unaffected and stable.

## ğŸ§ª Testing
- [ ] New tests have been added to cover all new functionality.
- [ ] Test coverage meets or exceeds 70% of relevant scenarios.
- [ ] Tests are meaningful and validate expected behavior.

## ğŸ“œ Documentation
- [ ] Documentation has been updated if necessary (e.g., README, Wiki).
- [ ] API endpoints are documented clearly (if applicable).

## ğŸ” Security
- [ ] No sensitive data is exposed via logs, variables, or commits.
- [ ] All user inputs are properly validated and sanitized.
- [ ] External libraries used are vetted and secure.
